channel.title: India on Enda Phelan
channel.description: Recent content in India on Enda Phelan

item.title: One Minute in India
item.description: A one minute montage of an entire month travelling in India!

item.title: One Month in India: Kerala
item.description: Kerala. God’s Own Country. Actually that title belongs to the Wicklow Mountains in Ireland but we’ll forgive them for that one. Just this once.

item.title: One Month in India: Hampi
item.description: Hampi is a small rural village in the south Indian state of Karnataka. Truth be told there’s not much happening in the village itself, but that’s not what you come to see.

item.title: One Month in India: Goa
item.description: Fifteen days after we touched Indian soil for the first time, our arrival to Goa marked the halfway point in our one month tour of India.

item.title: One Month in India: Mumbai
item.description: Mumbai holds the title of being India’s largest city, with an estimated population of around 24 million. The commercial centre of India, home to Asia’s largest slum, the world’s most expensive home and Bollywood; this is a city of extremes.

item.title: One Month in India: Udaipur
item.description: Udaipur is a must visit if you travel to India. It is sometimes called the ‘White City’ because of the colour of the buildings in the old city.

item.title: One Month in India: Agra
item.description: When people visit Agra - the second stop on India’s Golden Triangle - they are not coming to see the city that 1.6 million people call home.

item.title: One Month in India: Delhi
item.description: We leave the runway at Dublin Airport, starting our journey to South Asia. Five countries, six months. First stop - India.
